introduction.title: The Crow Queen
introduction.tagline: All land bends. All flesh kneels.
introduction.description: Once the absolute ruler of Monstru, the Crow Queen — now called the Regent Black — was deposed by the monster uprising. Stripped of her throne but not her will, she fled with her Inner Court into oblivion... until she discovered Coffin Canyon. Here, she seeks to claim a new realm, consecrating land, enslaving monsters, and erasing manlings from the soil she deems hers.
introduction.philosophy: Order is not negotiated. It is imposed. Monsters are tools, humans are cattle, and land exists to be ruled. The Regent Black does not conquer for wealth—she conquers to restore the natural hierarchy, with herself at its apex.
introduction.history: The fall of Monstru shattered the Crow Court, but it did not destroy it. Loyal servants followed the Queen into exile, carrying relics, rituals, and ancient knowledge of dominion. Coffin Canyon is not a refuge—it is a staging ground. Every battle fought here is another stone laid in the foundation of her returning empire.

core_values: Humans exist to submit or die
what_they_fight_for: Exaltation of land into royal demesne
Restoration of the Crow Queen’s sovereignty
what_they_fight_against: Any rival claim to land or authority

reputation.the_canyon_sees_them_as: A crown returning, one stone at a time

faction_mechanics.signature_ability_description: The Crow Queen faction reshapes the battlefield through Consecrated Ground generated by the Regent Black and Demesne Markers. This land suppresses morale failure and accelerates faction momentum.
faction_mechanics.playstyle: Slow, oppressive territorial control. The Crow Queen faction begins restrained, then snowballs as Consecrated Ground spreads. They excel at morale pressure, objective denial, and late-game inevitability.
weaknesses: Punished heavily if the Regent Black falls

preferred_states.reason: The Regent Black’s ideal outcome—land fully bound to her will

faction_features.name: Demesne Markers
faction_features.effect: Demesne Markers generate Consecrated Ground in a 12" radius. Effects are identical to the Regent Black’s Sovereign Presence.

faction_features.name: The Realm Answers
faction_features.effect: Enemy units within Consecrated Ground cannot ignore Shaken for any reason.

units.name: The Regent Black
units.lore: The Crow Queen herself. Calm, composed, and utterly certain of her right to rule. She does not rush—she waits for the land to remember who owns it.
units.tactics: Anchor the battlefield. Protect early, dominate late. Losing her is catastrophic.

units.name: Ladies in Waiting
units.lore: Silent attendants who carry the tools of rule: banners, markers, comforts, and poison-laced sweets.
units.tactics: Objective play and Demesne deployment. Fragile but essential.

optional_upgrades.name: Sweet Cakes
optional_upgrades.effect: Once per game: Remove Shaken from an allied unit within 6"

units.name: High Huntsman
units.lore: Master of the Queen’s hunts—whether manling or monster.

units.name: The Jester
units.lore: A laughing horror in bells and paint. Some say he is a Klowna. No one denies the fear he brings.
units.tactics: Disrupt morale and poison key zones.

units.name: Major Domo
units.lore: Banker, advisor, and keeper of the Queen’s ledgers. He ensures every sacrifice is counted.

units.name: Crown’s Champion
units.lore: The Queen’s shield and executioner in one.
units.tactics: Protect the Regent Black at all costs.

units.name: My Pet
units.lore: A small, collared creature that scurries ahead to claim what the Queen desires.
